snippet.textDisplay: I love lazy Sunday mornings. Another thing I love is this Korean MMORPG's soundtrack which I recently discovered. The game seems to be quite similar to something like Ragnarok Online, which also has superb music. This theme's a bit on the short side, but the groovy bass instantly pulls you in.
snippet.textOriginal: I love lazy Sunday mornings. Another thing I love is this Korean MMORPG's soundtrack which I recently discovered. The game seems to be quite similar to something like Ragnarok Online, which also has superb music. This theme's a bit on the short side, but the groovy bass instantly pulls you in.

snippet.textDisplay: Ragnarok online has amazing music. Check out Tree of Saviours ost it's just as great.
snippet.textOriginal: Ragnarok online has amazing music. Check out Tree of Saviours ost it's just as great.

snippet.textDisplay: While I don't have any interest in playing any Ragnarok game, I surely enjoyed the heck out of the soundtrack. Especially *The Ancient Magical City* from Ragnarok Battle Offline, I love that track so much!
snippet.textOriginal: While I don't have any interest in playing any Ragnarok game, I surely enjoyed the heck out of the soundtrack. Especially *The Ancient Magical City* from Ragnarok Battle Offline, I love that track so much!

snippet.textDisplay: SupraDarky I've never played this MMORPG before but the creator of this track also made music for La Tale before. If you look up their tracks for La Tale, you can definitely hear their style in it. Listening to this, I almost instantly reconized that this was ESTi's work!
snippet.textOriginal: SupraDarky I've never played this MMORPG before but the creator of this track also made music for La Tale before. If you look up their tracks for La Tale, you can definitely hear their style in it. Listening to this, I almost instantly reconized that this was ESTi's work!

snippet.textDisplay: The bassline almost sounds like the one in  Forbidden Fruit by J. Cole
snippet.textOriginal: The bassline almost sounds like the one in  Forbidden Fruit by J. Cole

snippet.textDisplay: Put it in a loop! Great
snippet.textOriginal: Put it in a loop! Great

snippet.textDisplay: An unfortunate case of great work stuck inside a terrible game. Stop trying to make a game that clearly would have been more suited for single player console RPG, into a MMORPG with lootboxes and p2w schemes
snippet.textOriginal: An unfortunate case of great work stuck inside a terrible game. Stop trying to make a game that clearly would have been more suited for single player console RPG, into a MMORPG with lootboxes and p2w schemes

snippet.textDisplay: The beat that starts right at the beginning sounds super familiar. The track sounds like it throws some premade beats and jingles together - I do like it though.
snippet.textOriginal: The beat that starts right at the beginning sounds super familiar. The track sounds like it throws some premade beats and jingles together - I do like it though.

snippet.textDisplay:
It really reminds me of this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XIJKJJvKKo4

And the beat from that was inspired by a Sonic level (don't remember which one), so this being a game music channel, you probably know it from that Sonic level.
snippet.textOriginal:
